channel.title: Laravel on Byte Ebi üç§
channel.description: Recent content in Laravel on Byte Ebi üç§

item.title: Introducing Laravel Sail and Basic Operations
item.description:
In the context of Laravel development environment setup, both official and unofficial sources offer a plethora of approaches.
This time, we will be introducing a package introduced after Laravel 8: Laravel Sail .

item.title: Laravel Queue Usage
item.description:
The purpose of queues is to defer processing of a time-consuming task that doesn’t require immediate completion. Like sending emails, users don’t need to wait for the email to be sent successfully before the next step.
Allowing the application to respond more quickly to web requests and smooth user experience.

item.title: Importing Excel or CSV Files into Laravel
item.description:
When the backend interface isn’t fully developed or when users have extensive data that they prefer not to input manually, opting for a bulk import via a form becomes essential.
This is where the Laravel-excel package comes into play. Additionally, it’s worth discussing the challenges encountered when importing a large volume of data at once.

item.title: Develop Your Own Laravel Package
item.description:
The Laravel ecosystem offers numerous convenient packages for various purposes.
However, what if you can’t find a suitable package or need to create a company-specific one?
This article demonstrates how to develop a package locally and install it in a Laravel project using composer, ensuring smooth development and testing.

item.title: Setting up Laravel Development Environment with Docker
item.description:
In the past, developing Laravel projects locally mostly involved installing the required services directly on the machine.
Later, the recommended development environment by the official documentation, Homestead , became a popular choice.

item.title: Environment Initialization and Server Configuration (Docker + Laravel)
item.description:
If you are setting up a new cloud server and want to create a Laravel development environment using Docker on it.
And run Laravel’s common composer and artisan commands remotely, here’s a guide for you.
